definition[0]: a large supply of things that is kept ready for use in the future
definition[1]: to keep adding to a supply of goods, weapons etc that you are keeping ready to use if you need them in the future
example[1]: An enormous volume of explosives was stockpiled inside one of the buildings.
definition[2]: to keep adding to a large supply of goods, weapons etc that are being kept for use or possible use in the future
example[2]: The US government began stockpiling oil in response to the oil embargo.
definition[3]: a large supply of goods, weapons etc that are being kept for use in the future, often because they will be difficult to obtain later
example[3]: Following poor harvests, stockpiles of grain are expected to fall to their tightest level for 20 years.
